sections.name: SECTION A - MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (MCQs)
instructions: Attempt all the Questions of this Section.
Do not copy down the part questions. Write only the answer against the proper number of the Question and its part according to the question Paper.

questions.question: Blood is one of the following:
Empirical formula of CH₃COOH is:
It is considered as the fourth state of matter:
The mass of this particle is almost equal to that of proton:
Line spectrum of Hydrogen atom was studied by:
This is the isotope of Hydrogen which contains greater number of neutron:
The radioactive element in I-A group is:
Dobereiner arranged elements in:
All transition elements are:
According to the modern periodic law presented by Moseley, the properties of elements are the periodic function of:
Synthetic resin binds two surfaces together by this bonding:
Nobel gases are stable because their valance shell contains these numbers of electron: (except Helium)
At room temperature, most of the ionic compounds are:
1 atm = ______ Pascal
Which of the following gas diffuses faster?
Benzene is an example of this type of solvent:
69 g of Sodium (Na) is equal to:
The size of particles in suspension is:
This one of the following is non-electrolyte:
This one is an alloy:
1 g equivalent weight of Al is equal to:
This gas turns lime water milky
This halogen exists in liquid state:
This element is metalloid:

sections.name: SECTION B - Short Answer Questions
instructions: Answer any EIGHT questions from this section.

questions.question: Define: (i) Tyndall effect (ii) Valency (iii) Electronegativity
Write down three differences between Alkali metals and Alkaline earth metals.
What is an aqueous solution? Give an example. Air is a mixture of gases then why Nitrogen gas is considered solvent?
What are isotopes? Describe isotopes of Chlorine.
Identify group and period in the period table of the following elements: (i) 3L (ii) 6C (iii) 13AL
Write down any three points of atomic model proposed by Schrodinger.
What is the mass of Oxalic acid (C₂H₂O₄) required to prepare 100 cm³ volume of 2M Oxalic acid solution? (where Atomic masses: C = 12, H = 1, O = 16)
Balance the following chemical equations: (i) Ca + O₂ → CaO (ii) KClO₃ → KCl + O₂ (iii) NH₃ + O₂ → NO + H₂O
State Faraday's 1st law of electrolysis and explain it
60ml sample of a gas is heated from 27°C to 52°C, at constant pressure. What will be final volume of this gas?
Write down the chemical formulae of given compounds: (i) Lime stone (ii) Washing soda (iii) Sugar
Give reason: (i) Why gasoline does not dissolve in water? (ii) Alkali metals are not found in Free State in nature, why?

sections.name: SECTION C - Detailed Answer Question
instructions: Attempt any TWO (2) questions from this section.

questions.question: Define Chemistry, and list any five branches of it and explain them.

Define ionic bond. Illustrate the bond formation in Sodium Chloride (NaCl) also write any two characteristics of ionic compounds. OR Describe discharge tube experiment with labelled diagram and state what were the justification and conclusion of J.J. Thomson in this respect.
What is electroplating? How can a steel spoon be electroplated with chromium explain with electrodes reaction also draw a labelled diagram of electrolytic cell.
